summary: Email correspondence between a US prosecutor and UK attorney Jill Greenfield regarding a client's willingness to speak with US investigators about the Epstein investigation. The email discusses logistical arrangements for the discussion and mentions travel restrictions.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who is willing to speak with US investigators about the Epstein case. She initiates contact to arrange a discussion.

connections.description: Jill Greenfield is representing a client who wants to speak with US investigators about the Epstein case.

events.title: Arrangement for client interview
events.description: Email correspondence arranging for Jill Greenfield's client to speak with US investigators about the Epstein investigation.

locations: London EC4R 3TT, United Kingdom (Fieldfisher office at Riverbank House, 2 Swan Lane)
United States (implied location of the investigating office)
keyFacts: A client represented by UK attorney Jill Greenfield is willing to speak with US investigators about the Epstein case.
The US investigation team has been updated with new personnel who have experience in similar cases.
Government foreign travel for the US investigators was prohibited at the time, preventing in-person meetings.
The email is part of the FFW-DOCS.FID6003375 document set related to the Epstein investigation.
